intro: Buphthalmum, commonly known as the "cow eye" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow or orange flowers that resemble the shape of an eye. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Buphthalmum species are native to Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. These plants are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
